Point of Order by Councillor Glenn De Baeremaeker

Councillor De Baeremaeker, rising on a Point of Order, stated that the Speaker should rule on whether Councillor Perks' questions of Councillor Berardinetti are in order.


Ruling by Speaker Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata accepted the Point of Order and ruled that Councillor Perks' questions were in order.

Councillor De Baeremaeker challenged the Speaker's ruling. Councillor De Baeremaeker subsequently withdrew his challenge and stated that the Speaker's comments about Members not listening was not fair.

Speaker Nunziata apologized for her comment.

Point of Privilege by Councillor Michelle Berardinetti

Councillor Berardinetti, rising on a Point of Privilege, stated that Councillor Perks used the word "dishonourable" in his comments about a Member who moved a motion on the Item and asked that he retract his comments.


Ruling by Speaker Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata accepted the Point of Privilege and ruled that Councillor Perk's comments were not in order and asked that he retract his comments.

Councillor Perks stated that he did not recall using the word "dishonourable" and if he did, he apologized.

Point of Order by Councillor Mark Grimes

Councillor Grimes, rising on a Point of Order, stated that the need clarification on the order of the voting.


Ruling by Speaker Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata accepted the Point of Order and ruled that the motions would be voted on in the order that they were moved.

Point of Order by Councillor John Filion

Councillor Filion, rising on a Point of Order, stated that the Speaker should clarify whether the confidential instructions to staff were on the floor.


Ruling by Speaker Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata accepted the Point of Order and ruled that they were not on the floor until moved.

Point of Order by Councillor David Shiner

Councillor Shiner, rising on a Point of Order, stated that he needed clarification on why the instructions to staff are confidential.


Ruling by Speaker Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata accepted the Point of Order and asked the City Solicitor to advise Council. The City Solicitor advised that confidential instructions on Labour Relations matters are dealt with in closed session.

CC54.3

ACTION 

Amended 

 

Ward:All 
Integrity Commissioner Report on Violation of Code of Conduct: Councillor Mammoliti
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council adopt the finding that Councillor Mammoliti has violated the Code of Conduct.

 

2.         City Council suspend the remuneration paid to Councillor Mammoliti in respect of his services as a member of Council for a period of 90 days, commencing September 1, 2014.

 

3.         City Council request the City Solicitor to retain outside counsel with expertise in criminal law to review the Integrity Commissioner's report to determine if there are grounds to refer this matter to the Chief of Police, Toronto Police Service, for further investigation.
City Council Decision Advice and Other Information

The Integrity Commissioner gave an overview to Council on her report on Violation of Code of Conduct: Councillor Mammoliti.
Background Information (City Council)
(June 24, 2014) Report from the Integrity Commissioner on Violation of Code of Conduct: Councillor Mammoliti (CC54.3)
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/cc/bgrd/backgroundfile-71097.pdf)
Attachments 1 to 35 as listed in the report
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/cc/bgrd/backgroundfile-71098.pdf)
Communications (City Council)
(July 7, 2014) Letter from Morris Manning (CC.New.CC54.3.1)
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/cc/comm/communicationfile-48606.pdf)
(July 9, 2014) E-mail from Staff A (CC.New.CC54.3.2)
Motions (City Council)
1 - Motion to Defer Item moved by James Maloney (Withdrawn)
That consideration of the item be deferred until such time as the Divisional Court has rendered its decision on the Application for Judicial Review and all appeals have been exhausted in respect of the Integrity Commisioner's investigation.

Motion to Withdraw a Motion moved by James Maloney (Carried)

That Councillor Maloney be permitted to withdraw motion 1.

CC54.5

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:All 
Status Update - Internet Voting Service for Persons with Disabilities for the 2014 Municipal Election
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council request the City Clerk to continue to work with persons with disabilities, organizations that represent them and the Disability Issues Committee to ensure accessible elections and to consider options for internet and telephone voting in future elections.

 

2.         City Council amend by-law 120-2014 to authorize the use of internet and telephone voting by all electors in advance voting as the City Clerk deems appropriate for conducting future elections.

 

3.         City Council request the City Clerk to report back to the August 26 and 27, 2014 meeting of Council on a plan for potential implementation of internet and telephone voting in future elections.
Background Information (City Council)
(July 7, 2014) Report from the City Clerk, the Chief Information Officer and the City Manager on Status Update - Internet Voting Service for Persons with Disabilities for the 2014 Municipal Election (CC54.5)
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/cc/bgrd/backgroundfile-71290.pdf)
(July 2, 2014) Report from the City Clerk on Status Update - Internet Voting Service for Persons with Disabilities for the 2014 Municipal Election - Notice of Pending Report (CC54.5)
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/cc/bgrd/backgroundfile-71069.pdf)
Communications (City Council)
(July 7, 2014) E-mail from Sandra Carpenter (CC.New.CC54.5.1)

CC54.7

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:14 
Queen Street West (between Roncesvalles Avenue and Dufferin Street) - Restaurant Study Zoning By-law Appeal Settlement Offer
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council reject the settlement offer contained in Attachment 1 to the report (July 2, 2014) from the City Solicitor and the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning.

 

2.         City Council repeal Interim Control By-law 1393-2012.

 

3.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to consent to an adjournment of the hearing of the appeals of By-laws 1049-2013 and 1050-2013, pending input from the working group which Council has directed be established to develop better compliance with City by-laws regarding restaurants, bars and entertainment establishments, as per Motion MM45.16, adopted by City Council on December 16, 17 and 18, 2013.

 

4.         City Council request the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning and the City Solicitor to report in the first half of 2015 on the status of and for further direction regarding the Ontario Restaurant, Hotel and Motel Association's appeals of By-laws 1049-2013 and 1050-2013.
Background Information (City Council)
(July 2, 2014) Report from the City Solicitor and the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning on Queen Street West (between Roncesvalles Avenue and Dufferin Street) - Restaurant Study Zoning By-law Appeal Settlement Offer (CC54.7)
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/cc/bgrd/backgroundfile-71107.pdf)

Member Motions - Meeting 54
MM54.1

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:20 
Request to Adjust Pay Parking Machine Hours on Queen Street West between Spadina Avenue and Simcoe Street - by Councillor Josh Colle, seconded by Councillor Gary Crawford
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council request the Director, Transportation Services, Toronto and East York, to adjust the Pay Parking Machine Hours on Queen Street West between Spadina Avenue and Simcoe Street to end at 9:00 p.m.

 

2.         City Council amend all related by-laws accordingly.
City Council Decision Advice and Other Information

City Council re-opened Item PW27.13 adopted by City Council on December 16, 17 and 18, 2013, only as it pertains to Pay Parking Machine Hours on Queen Street West, for further consideration.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.1
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71056.pdf)

Speaker Nunziata advised Council that consideration of Motion MM54.1 requires a re-opening of PW27.13 (City Council –  December 16, 17 and 18, 2013). A two-thirds vote of the Council Members present is required to re-open the Item.

Motion to Adopt Item (Carried)

Vote (Adopt Item)

Jul-10-2014 2:17 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - MM54.1 - Adopt the item

MM54.4

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:All 
Norman Bethune Day - by Councillor Paul Ainslie, seconded by Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council commemorate the 75th Anniversary of the death of Norman Bethune, a great Canadian who influenced medicine worldwide and honours our City with his inventive and life saving medical procedures and influence.

 

2.         City Council proclaim November 12, 2014 as Norman Bethune Day.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.4
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71049.pdf)

Vote (Waive Referral)

MM54.6

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:All 
Changes to the 'Retirement Homes Act, 2010' by the Government of Ontario and its Impact on the City of Toronto's By-laws - by Councillor Chin Lee, seconded by Councillor Josh Matlow
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following::

 

1.         City Council direct the Executive Director, Municipal Licensing and Standards, in consultation with Toronto Public Health, City Planning, any other City of Toronto Division involved with retirement homes, the Retirement Homes Regulatory Authority (RHRA) and the Government of Ontario, to report back to the August 26 and 27, 2014 meeting of City Council, on what changes are required to bring the City of Toronto's by-laws in compliance with the updated Retirement Homes Act, 2010.

MM54.11

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:5 
Request for Attendance at an Ontario Municipal Board Hearing - Appeal of Committee of Adjustment Decision Respecting 64 Brentwood Road South - by Councillor Peter Leon, seconded by Councillor Vincent Crisanti
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

 1.        City Council authorize the City Solicitor and City Planning Staff to attend at the Ontario Municipal Board in support of the Committee of Adjustment decision to refuse the minor variance application (A140/14EYK) for 64 Brentwood Road South and authorize the City Solicitor to retain an independent land use planner if necessary.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.11
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71067.pdf)
Committee of Adjustment Etobicoke York Panel - Notice of Decision on Minor Variance/Permission for 64 Brentwood Road South
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71068.pdf)

MM54.13

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:All 
Fair Media Access on City Property - by Councillor Paula Fletcher, seconded by Councillor Sarah Doucette
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council direct that for all events held by the City, Mayor or Councillors to which media are invited, held at City Hall or in a City facility, all media outlets that are members of the City Hall Press Gallery be included.

 

2.         City Council direct that City staff, including facilities and communications staff, only support events to which media are invited in spaces large enough to accommodate the expected numbers of media, such as the Members Lounge.
Background Information (City Council)
Revised Member Motion MM54.13
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71096.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Waive Referral (Carried)

Speaker Nunziata advised Council that the provisions of Chapter 27, Council Procedures, require that Motion MM54.13 be referred to the Government Management Committee. A two-thirds vote of the Council Members present is required to waive referral.


Vote (Waive Referral)

MM54.14

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:All 
A Sign of Citizen Engagement: Improving Development Proposal Public Notices - by Councillor Josh Matlow, seconded by Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council request the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning to:

 

a.         undertake a review of the Development Proposal Public Notices toward signs that are attractive, use language that is informative and easy to understand while encouraging citizen involvement in the planning process;

 

b.         consult with residents' associations, development industry representatives and other relevant stakeholders while conducting the review; and

 

c.         report on the outcome of the review to the March 2015 meeting of the Planning and Growth Management Committee.

MM54.15

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:13 
Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to the Toronto District School Board for the Construction of Childcare Facilities at Swansea Junior and Senior Public School - by Councillor Sarah Doucette, seconded by Councillor Paula Fletcher
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

 1.        City Council authorize the transfer of $337,128 from the Planning Act Reserve Fund (Source Account: XR3026-3700528), fully funded by Section 37 community benefits from the development at 2464, 2474 and 2490 Bloor Street West/1 Old Mill Drive, to the Child Care Capital Reserve Fund XR1103, to provide funding for the construction by the Toronto District School Board of a non-profit childcare facility at Swansea Junior and Senior Public School, 207 Windermere Avenue.

 

2.         City Council authorize an increase in the 2014 Approved Operating Budget for Children's Services of $337,128 gross, $0 net so that funds can be forwarded from the Child Care Capital Reserve Fund XR1103 to the Toronto District School Board  in accordance with the terms of agreement between the City and the Toronto District School Board for the construction of the child care facility at Swansea Junior and Senior Public School.

 

3.         City Council direct that, prior to any funds being forwarded to the Toronto District School Board, the Toronto District School Board enter into agreements with the City with respect to the specifications, construction and operation of the childcare facilities, and the transfer of funds from the City to Toronto District School Board, with terms and conditions satisfactory to the General Manager, Children's Services and in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor.

 

4.         City Council authorize and direct the appropriate City officials to take all necessary action to give effect to Council's decision, and authorize the General Manager, Children's Services to execute the agreements with the Toronto District School Board on behalf of the City.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.15
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71101.pdf)
(July 9, 2014) Fiscal Impact Statement from the Deputy City Manager and Chief Financial Officer
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71433.pdf)

MM54.16

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:13 
Planning Study for Bloor Street West between Keele Street and the Humber River - Councillor Sarah Doucette, seconded by Councillor Paula Fletcher
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council request the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning to:

 

a.         undertake a review of the current built-form, density, height, and heritage value of the properties on Bloor Street West between Keele Street and the Humber River;

 

b.         consult with the community, including landowners and other stakeholder groups, together with the Ward Councillor, to understand the community's concerns and develop a vision for future development in the study area; and

 

c.         report back on the findings of the review and to provide recommendations for changes, if necessary, to the planning framework for the study area.
Background Information (City Council)

MM54.18

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:10 
Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to the Toronto District School Board towards Capital Improvements to the Playground at Faywood Public School - by Councillor James Pasternak, seconded by Councillor Ana Bail�o
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council increase the approved 2014 Operating Budget for Non-Program by $110,000 gross, $0 net, fully funded by Section 37 community benefits obtained in the development at 545-555 Wilson Avenue, (source account XR3026-3700537), for the purpose of forwarding funds to the Toronto District School Board for the capital improvements to the school playgrounds at Faywood Arts-Based Curriculum (ABC) Public School, and more specifically, the construction of a fully accessible playground.

 

2.         City Council direct that the funds be forwarded to the Toronto District School Board once the School Board has signed a Community Access Agreement with the City, governing the purpose of the funds, the financial reporting requirements, and addressing community access to the improved facilities, drawn up in consultation with the Ward Councillor.

 

3.         City Council authorize the execution of a Community Access Agreement with the Toronto District School Board for the capital improvements to the grounds at Faywood ABC Public School, to the satisfaction of the City Solicitor.

 

4.         City Council request the Director, Community Planning to participate in the preparation of the Community Access Agreement and request the City Solicitor to draw up the Agreement, in consultation with the Ward Councillor and Community Planning staff.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.18
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71295.pdf)

Yes: 38 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, Sarah Doucette, John Filion, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Ron Moeser, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, James Pasternak, Gord Perks, Anthony Perruzza, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Jaye Robinson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

MM54.19

ACTION 

Amended 

 

Ward:All 
Electronic Dance Music Concerts - by Councillor Mark Grimes, seconded by Councillor Vincent Crisanti
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council receive the recommendations of the Board of Governors of Exhibition Place for information.

 

2          City Council direct that Confidential Appendix C, being Confidential Attachment 1 to the Board's report (January 21, 2014) entitled "Electronic Dance Music Concerts", not be released publicly in order to protect the competitive positions and future economic interests of Exhibition Place.

 

3.         City Council direct that Confidential Appendix E, being Confidential Attachment 1 to the City Solicitor's report (April 7, 2014) entitled "Electronic Dance Music Concerts" remain confidential as it contains advice and information that is subject to solicitor-client privilege.

 

Confidential Attachment 1 to the Board's report (January 21, 2014) entitled "Electronic Dance Music Concerts" attached as Appendix C, remains confidential in its entirely in accordance with the provisions of the City of Toronto Act, 2006, to protect the competitive positions and future economic interests of Exhibition Place.

 

Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (April 7, 2014) from the City Solicitor, attached as Appendix E, remains confidential in its entirety in accordance with the provisions of the City of Toronto Act, 2006, as it relates to the receiving of advice and information that is subject to solicitor-client privilege.
Confidential Attachment - The receiving of advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege

Motion to Waive Notice (Carried)

Speaker Nunziata advised Council that the necessary provisions of Chapter 27, Council Procedures, need to be waived to permit introduction of Motion MM54.19. A two-thirds vote of the Council Members present is required to waive notice.

Jul-09-2014 3:00 PM
Result: Carried Two-Thirds Required - MM54.19 - Waive notice
Yes: 38 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, Sarah Doucette, John Filion, Paula Fletcher, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Ron Moeser, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, James Pasternak, Gord Perks, Anthony Perruzza, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Jaye Robinson, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 2 Mary Fragedakis, Pam McConnell 
Absent: 5 Gary Crawford, Doug Ford, David Shiner, Karen Stintz, Michael Thompson 

1 - Motion to Adopt Item as Amended moved by Councillor Gord Perks (Carried)

That City Council:

 

1.         receive the recommendations of the Board of Governors of Exhibition Place for information;

 

2.         direct the confidential information contained in the Board's report dated January 21, 2014 entitled "Electronic Dance Music Concerts", attached as Appendix B, not be released publicly in order to protect the competitive positions and future economic interests of Exhibition Place; and

 

3.         direct the Confidential Attachment 1 to the City Solicitor's report dated April 7, 2014 entitled "Electronic Dance Music Concerts" attached as Appendix E remain confidential  as it contains advice and information that is subject to solicitor-client privilege.


Vote (Adopt Item as Amended)

Jul-11-2014 5:53 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - MM54.19 - Perks - Adopt the item as amended
Yes: 19 Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Shelley Carroll, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

Absent: 19 Michelle Berardinetti, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, John Filion, Doug Ford, Rob Ford, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Ron Moeser, James Pasternak, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Karen Stintz 

2 - Motion to Amend Item moved by Councillor Mike Layton (Redundant)

That City Council amend Recommendation 3 by adding the words "unless accompanied by a parent or guardian" so that it now reads as follows:

 

3.         Authorize the Board to set an age restriction of 16 years and older for attendees at EDMs at Exhibition Place unless accompanied by a parent or guardian.


Ruling by Speaker Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata ruled motion 2 by Councillor Layton redundant due to Council's adoption of motion 1 by Councillor Perks.

MM54.20

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:13 
1926 Lake Shore Boulevard West - Request for further direction - by Councillor Sarah Doucette, seconded by Councillor Frank Di Giorgio
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council adopt the instructions to staff in Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor.

 

2.         City Council authorize the public release only of the Confidential Recommendation 1 and Appendices 1 and 2 to the Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor and direct that the remainder of the Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor shall remain confidential in all circumstances as it contains advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege and information regarding pending litigation before the Ontario Municipal Board.

 

Confidential Recommendation 1 in Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor was adopted by City Council and is now public:

 

1.         City Council accept the settlement offer dated June 27, 2014, attached as Appendix 1 (the "Settlement Offer") and:

 

a.         endorse the allocation of the remainder of the Section 37 contribution, as set out in Appendix 2 to this Confidential Attachment (the "Section 37 Remainder Allocation");

 

b.         authorize the public release of the Settlement Offer and the Section 37 Remainder Allocation being Appendices 1 and 2 to this Confidential Attachment;

 

c.         direct staff to keep the Swansea Area Ratepayers Group apprised of discussion and progress with respect to the Section 37 Agreement;

 

d.         direct the City Solicitor to attend the Ontario Municipal Board hearing in support of a Zoning By-law Amendment so as to implement the Settlement Offer and the Section 37 Remainder Allocation, in accordance with Appendices 1 and 2 of this Confidential Attachment;

 

e.         approve the dedication of the 3.0 metre wide strip of City-owned lands located between the subject property and Windemere Avenue as public highway;

 

f.          direct staff to involve the Swansea Area Ratepayers Group in discussions relating to site plan approval once a site plan approval application has been submitted;

 

g.         direct staff work with the applicant in the context of the site plan application process, to determine how to appropriately limit access at the Windemere Avenue driveway;

 

h.         direct the City Solicitor to request the consent of the applicant and the Swansea Area Ratepayers Group to amend item 2(c) of the Settlement Offer, with respect to liability insurance and naming certain condominium corporations as additional insured parties for property damage, such that the obligation is no longer required to be included in the Section 37 Agreement but rather is secured to the Swansea Area Ratepayers Group's satisfaction through other legally enforceable means; and

 

i.          City Council authorize and direct appropriate City officials to take the necessary action to give effect to the terms of settlement and each of these recommendations.

 

Appendices 1 and 2 to Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor are now public in their entirety and can be accessed under Background Information (City Council).

 

The balance Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor remains confidential in its entirety in accordance with the provisions of the City of Toronto Act, 2006, as it contains advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege and it pertains to pending litigation before the Ontario Municipal Board.
Confidential Attachment - Litigation or potential litigation, including matters before administrative tribunals, affecting the municipality or local board and advice that is subject to solicitor client privilege

MM54.21

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:16 
2360-2378 Yonge Street and 31, 33, 35 and 37 Helendale Avenue - Request for directions regarding Ontario Municipal Board Hearing - by Councillor Karen Stintz, seconded by Councillor Mary-Margaret McMahon
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council adopt the recommendations contained in Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor.

 

2.         City Council direct that the recommendations contained in Confidential Attachment 1 and the information contained in Confidential Appendix "A" to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor be made public at the discretion of the City Solicitor.  City Council direct that the balance of information contained in Confidential Attachment 1 the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor is to remain confidential.

 

The recommendations in Confidential Attachment 1 and the information contained in Confidential Appendix "A" to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor remain confidential in their entirety at this time in accordance with the provisions of the City of Toronto Act, 2006, as they relate to the receiving of advice or communication that is subject to solicitor-client privilege and they pertain to litigation or potential litigation.  The recommendations in Confidential Attachment 1 and the information contained in Confidential Appendix "A" to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor will be made public at the discretion of the City Solicitor.

 

The balance of Confidential Attachment 1 and Confidential Appendices "B" and "C" to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor remain confidential in their entirety in accordance with the provisions of the City of Toronto Act, 2006, as they relate to the receiving of advice or communication that is subject to solicitor-client privilege and they pertain to litigation or potential litigation.

 

The following recommendations in Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor were made public on August 14, 2014:

 

1.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to advise the Ontario Municipal Board (OMB) that City Council supports a settlement in principle of the zoning by-law appeals related to 2360-2378 Yonge Street and 31, 33, 35 and 37 Helendale Avenue (the “Appeals”), provided the following key points are met:

 

a.         The sites at 2360-2378 Yonge Street and 31, 33, 35 and 37 Helendale Avenue shall be the subject of a joint development proposal, the built form of which will be substantially as set out in Appendix “A” to this report;

 

b.         The development proposal shall include the replacement of all 19 existing residential rental units, all to the satisfaction of the Chief Planner; and

 

c.         The owner will provide community benefits, pursuant to Section 37 of the Planning Act, having a value of $1.5 million dollars, indexed in accordance with City practice, prior to the first above-grade building permit. Such funds shall be used by the City in its discretion for local streetscaping improvements, and/or public realm improvements and/or the Northern District Library. In addition, the owner shall provide for streetscape improvements to Yonge Street and to Helendale Avenue abutting the site in accordance with designs to be approved in connection with the Midtown in Focus, Parks, Open Space and Streetscape Master Plan Study for Yonge-Eglinton. The community benefits will be secured in an agreement pursuant to Section 37 of the Planning Act in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor, and shall be registered prior to a final order on the Appeals by the OMB.

 

2.         The owner shall address on-site loading and pick-up/drop-off issues, to the satisfaction of General Manager of Transportation Services;

 

3.         The City Solicitor and Chief Planner be jointly authorized to support minor changes to the final built form of the development proposal; and

 

4.         The City Solicitor, in consultation with the Chief Planner, be authorized to finalize the elements of the settlement, including the final form of the minutes of settlement, the zoning by-law and any other related planning instruments and be authorized to request that the OMB approve the development in accordance with the above recommendations.

 

Confidential Appendix A to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor is now public in its entirety and can be accessed under Background Information (City Council).
Confidential Attachment - Litigation or potential litigation, including matters before administrative tribunals, affecting the municipality or local board and advice that is subject to solicitor client privilege
Background Information (City Council)

(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71332.pdf)

(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71333.pdf)
Confidential Attachment 1
Confidential Appendix A - Built Form Terms - made public on August 14, 2014

MM54.22

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:13 
Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to the Toronto District School Board for the Construction of Childcare Facilities at Western Technical-Commercial School - by Councillor Sarah Doucette, seconded by Councillor Janet Davis
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council authorize the transfer of $30,000 from the Planning Act Reserve Fund (Source Account: XR3026-3700604), fully funded by Section 37 community benefits from the development at 2500 Bloor Street West/2 Old Mill Drive, to the Child Care Capital Reserve Fund XR1103, to provide funding for renovations by the Toronto District School Board of a non-profit childcare facility at Western Technical-Commercial School, 125 Evelyn Crescent.

 

2.         City Council authorize an increase in the 2014 Approved Operating Budget for Children's Services of $30,000 gross, $0 net so that funds can be forwarded from the Child Care Capital Reserve Fund XR1103 to the Toronto District School Board in accordance with the terms of agreement between the City and the Toronto District School Board for the renovations of the child care facility at the Western Technical-Commercial School.

 

3.         City Council direct that, prior to any funds being forwarded to the Toronto District School Board, the Toronto District School Board enter into agreements with the City with respect to the specifications, renovations and operation of the childcare facilities, and the transfer of funds from the City to Toronto District School Board, with terms and conditions satisfactory to the General Manager, Children's Services and in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor.

 

4.         City Council authorize and direct the appropriate City officials to take all necessary action to give effect to Council's decision and authorize the General Manager, Children's Services to execute the agreements with the Toronto District School Board on behalf of the City.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.22
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71308.pdf)
(July 9, 2014) Fiscal Impact Statement from the Deputy City Manager and Chief Financial Officer
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71437.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Sarah Doucette (Carried)

That Councillor Sarah Doucette be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to the Toronto District School Board for the Construction of Childcare Facilities at Western Technical-Commercial School

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as the Toronto District School Board will begin construction shortly and these funds are required to fund the renovations to the child care facility.

MM54.24

ACTION

Ward:13 
Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to the Toronto District School Board for the Construction of Childcare Facilities at Keele Street Junior and Senior Public School - Councillor Sarah Doucette, seconded by Councillor Janet Davis
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council authorize the transfer of $357,267 from the Planning Act Reserve Fund (Source Account: XR3026-3700528), fully funded by Section 37 community benefits from the development at 2464, 2474 and 2490 Bloor Street West/1 Old Mill Drive, and $179,536 from the Planning Act Reserve Fund (Source Account: XR3026-3700604 ), from the development at 2500 Bloor Street West /2 Old Mill Drive, for a total of $536,803 to the Child Care Capital Reserve Fund XR1103, to provide funding for the construction by the Toronto District School Board of a non-profit childcare facility at Keele Street Junior and Senior Public School.

 

2.         City Council authorize an increase in the 2014 Approved Operating Budget for Children's Services of $536,803 gross, $0 net so that funds can be forwarded from the Child Care Capital Reserve Fund XR1103 to the Toronto District School Board in accordance with the terms of agreement between the City and the Toronto District School Board for the construction of the child care facility at Keele Street Junior and Senior Public School.

 

3.         City Council direct that, prior to any funds being forwarded to the Toronto District School Board, the Toronto District School Board enter into agreements with the City with respect to the specifications, construction and operation of the childcare facilities, and the transfer of funds from the City of Toronto to Toronto District School Board, with terms and conditions satisfactory to the General Manager, Children's Services and in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor.

 

4.         City Council authorize and direct the appropriate City officials to take all necessary action to give effect to Council's decision and authorize the General Manager, Children's Services to execute the three agreements with the Toronto District School Board on behalf of the City.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.24
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71324.pdf)
(July 9, 2014) Fiscal Impact Statement from the Deputy City Manager and Chief Financial Officer
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71438.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Sarah Doucette (Carried)

That Councillor Sarah Doucette be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to the Toronto District School Board for the Construction of Childcare Facilities at Keele Street Junior and Senior Public School

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as construction of the child care facility will begin shortly and the Toronto District School Board requires these funds as soon as possible.


Vote (Introduce Motion without Notice)

Jul-09-2014 10:25 AM

MM54.25

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:19 
AGCO Liquor Licence Application- 1166 Dundas Street West, The Contender - File# 816837 - by Councillor Mike Layton, seconded by Councillor Mary-Margaret McMahon
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council direct the City Clerk to advise the Registrar of the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario that the liquor licence application for 1166 Dundas Street West, operating under the name "The Contender" (“Premises”), is not in the public interest having regard to the needs and wishes of the residents, and that the Registrar should issue a Proposal to Review the liquor licence application.

 

2.         City Council request the Licence Appeal Tribunal to provide the City with an opportunity to be made a party in any proceedings with respect to the Premises.

 

3.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to attend all proceedings before the Licence Appeal Tribunal in this matter and direct the City Solicitor to take all necessary action so as to give effect to this Motion, including adding and deleting conditions to any liquor licence issued for the Premises, in consultation with the Ward Councillor, which address issues including, but not limited to, noise, litter, safety, lighting and other potential disturbances to residents in the area.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.25
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71319.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Mike Layton (Carried)

That Councillor Mike Layton be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario Liquor Licence Application - 1166 Dundas Street West - The Contender File No. 816837

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as the City needs to file its objection to the liquor licence application as soon as possible because there is a deadline.

City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

 1.        City Council direct the City Clerk to advise the Registrar of the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario that the liquor licence application for Gwailo, 503 College Street (the “Premises”), is not in the public interest having regard to the needs and wishes of the residents, and that the Registrar should issue a Proposal to Review the liquor licence application.

 

2.         City Council request the Licence Appeal Tribunal to provide the City with an opportunity to be made a party in any proceedings with respect to the Premises.

 

3.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to attend all proceedings before the Licence Appeal Tribunal in this matter and direct the City Solicitor to take all necessary actions so as to give effect to this Motion, including adding and deleting conditions to any liquor licence issued for the Premises, in consultation with the Ward Councillor, which address issues including, but not limited to, noise, safety, security personnel, security cameras, crowd control, signage, lighting and litter.

3.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to attend all proceedings before the Licence Appeal Tribunal in this matter and direct the City Solicitor to take all necessary actions so as to give effect to this Motion, including adding and deleting conditions to any liquor licence issued for the Premises, in consultation with the Ward Councillor, which address issues including, but not limited to, noise, safety, security personnel, security cameras, crowd control, signage, lighting and litter.

MM54.31

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:27 
89 Avenue Road: Municipal Board Appeal re Zoning Amendment - by Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam, seconded by Councillor Frank Di Giorgio
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

 1.        City Council amend Part 1.f. of Item TE30.97 adopted by Council at its meeting on March 20, 2014 to provide for the following:

 

"The owner will provide community benefits, pursuant to Section 37 of the Planning Act, having a value of $650,000, indexed in accordance with City practice, prior to the first above-grade building permit. Such funds shall be used by the City for local streetscaping improvements (including the hydro burying initiative in the Yorkville Triangle Neighbourhood) and/or for capital improvements to local parks. The community benefits will be secured in an agreement pursuant to Section 37 of the Act in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor."
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM 54.31
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71317.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam (Carried)

That Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

89 Avenue Road - Municipal Board Appeal - Zoning Amendment

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent because the parties are to appear before the Ontario Municipal Board on July 30, 31 and August 1, 2014.


Vote (Introduce Motion without Notice)

Jul-09-2014 10:34 AM

City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

 1.        City Council increase the approved 2014 Operating Budget for Parks, Forestry and Recreation by $48,210.40 gross, $0 net, fully funded by $48,210.40 of Section 42 funds obtained in the development of 106-108 Holland Park Avenue for the purpose of forwarding funds to Toronto Parks Forestry and Recreation for capital improvements to the grounds at Wadsworth Park, and more specifically for new park benches and upgrading of playground equipment to be installed in the spring.

(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71318.pdf)

That Councillor Cesar Palacio be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Authorization to Release Section 42 Funds to Toronto Parks, Forestry and Recreation towards the purchase and installation of new Park Benches at Wadsworth Park

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as planned improvements to the park are in the final stages and the commitment of these funds is needed to incorporate the upgrades and to immediately change the benches that pose a health and safety issue.

MM54.33

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:34 
88 Sunrise Avenue and 22 Hobson Avenue - OMB Appeal - by Councillor Denzil Minnan-Wong, seconded by Councillor James Maloney
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor and appropriate City Planning Staff to attend the Ontario Municipal Board hearing in opposition to the application in its present form respecting 88 Sunrise Avenue and 22 Hobson Avenue.

 

2.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to negotiate with the applicant, in consultation with the local Ward Councillor, to achieve reductions in the overall scale of the proposal and/or to secure conditions of approval in order to mitigate the impacts of the proposal on neighbouring properties.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.33
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71343.pdf)

MM54.35

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:16 
Application for Part Lot Control Exemption - 486 Lytton Boulevard and 2675-2681 Bathurst Street - by Councillor Karen Stintz, seconded by Councillor Josh Colle
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council enact a Part Lot Control Exemption By-law with respect to the subject lands at 486 Lytton Blvd and 2675 – 2681 Bathurst St as generally illustrated on Attachment 1 to report dated  June 30, 2014, to be prepared to the satisfaction of the City Solicitor and to expire two years following enactment by City Council.

 

2.         City Council direct that the seven lots that will be subject to Part Lot Control are part of Lots 105 and 127, and part of Block B on Plan 1611 designated as Parts 2 through 8 on Plan 66R-26203.

 

3.         City Council require the owner to provide proof of payment of all current property taxes for the subject lands to the satisfaction of the City Solicitor, prior to the enactment of the Part Lot Control Exemption By-law.

 

4.         City Council authorize and direct the City Solicitor to register the Part Lot Control Exemption By-law on title.

 

5.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to make such stylistic and technical changes to the draft Part Lot Control Exemption By-law as may be required.

 

6.         Prior to the introduction of the Part Lot Control Exemption Bill, City Council require the owner to register, to the satisfaction of the City Solicitor, a Section 118 Restriction under the Land Titles Act agreeing not to transfer or mortgage any part of the lands without the written consent of the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning or her designate.

 

7.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to take the necessary steps to release the Section 118 Restriction from title after confirmation that an easement over a portion of the lot described as Part of Lot 127 and Part of Block B, Plan 1611, designated as Part 1 on Plan 66R-26203, for purposes of the maintenance of the storm water sewer running from the common elements roadway across these lands to connect into the storm water outflow on Bathurst Street, is transferred to the common element condominium corporation.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.35
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71325.pdf)
(June 30, 2014) Report from the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning on Part Lot Control Exemption Application - 486 Lytton Boulevard and 2657-2681 Bathurst Street
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71326.pdf)
Motions (City Council)

That Councillor Karen Stintz be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Application for Part Lot Control Exemption - 486 Lytton Boulevard and 2675-2681 Bathurst Street

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as closing dates for the sales of some of the lots to the general public have passed.

MM54.36

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:27 
625, 629 and 637 Yonge Street and 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9 Isabella Street - Request for directions regarding the July 24, 2014 Ontario Municipal Board Hearing - by Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam, seconded by Councillor Mary-Margaret McMahon
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council adopt the confidential instructions to staff in Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor.

 

2.         City Council authorize the public release of Confidential Recommendations 1 and 2 as well as Confidential Appendix 1 to Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor and City Council direct that the remainder of Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor remain confidential as it contains advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege and information regarding pending litigation before the Ontario Municipal Board.

 

Confidential Recommendations 1 and 2 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor were adopted by City Council and are now public:

 

1.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to accept the owner's without prejudice settlement offer, dated July 4, 2014, as set out in Appendix 1 to this Attachment and to finalize and execute the associated Minutes of Settlement.

 

2.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to support the proposed Zoning By-law Amendment at the Ontario Municipal Board in accordance with the Minutes of Settlement.

 

Confidential Appendix 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor is now public in its entirety and can be accessed under Background Information (City Council).

 

The balance of Confidential Attachment 1 to the report (July 8, 2014) from the City Solicitor remains confidential in its entirety in accordance with the provisions of the City of Toronto Act, 2006, as it contains advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege and it pertains to pending litigation before the Ontario Municipal Board.
Confidential Attachment - Litigation or potential litigation, including matters before administrative tribunals, affecting the municipality or local board and advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.36
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71355.pdf)

MM54.37

ACTION 

Amended 

 

Ward:All 
Protecting Toronto's Tree Canopy on Business and Multi-Residential Lands - by Councillor Gloria Lindsay Luby, seconded by Councillor Glenn De Baeremaeker
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council request the General Manager, Parks, Forestry and Recreation to report to the Parks and Environment Committee in January 2015 to consider the requirement that businesses, industrial locations, institutions and multi-residential properties not be included in the exception categories under the By-law, thus requiring permits and replanting when dead and dying trees are removed.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.37
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71362.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Gloria Lindsay Luby (Carried)

That Councillor Gloria Lindsay Luby be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Protecting Toronto's Tree Canopy on Business and Multi-Residential Lands

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as staff have already begun the review of the Private Tree By-law.


Vote (Introduce Motion without Notice)

Jul-10-2014 9:56 AM
Result: Carried Two-Thirds full Council Required - Lindsay Luby - Add Urgent Motion

Jul-10-2014 2:24 PM

Jul-11-2014 9:57 AM
Result: Carried Two-Thirds Required - MM54.37 - Re-open the item
Yes: 27 Paul Ainslie, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Rob Ford, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), John Parker, James Pasternak, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

Absent: 18 Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Gary Crawford, Vincent Crisanti, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, John Filion, Doug Ford, Mark Grimes, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Ron Moeser, Cesar Palacio, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, Karen Stintz 

1 - Motion to Amend Item moved by Councillor Glenn De Baeremaeker (Carried)

That City Council amend the MM54.37 Recommendation by deleting the words "when the Private Tree By-law is next reviewed for potential revisions" and instead adding the words "to report to the Parks and Environment Committee in January 2015" so that the recommendation now reads:

 

1.         City Council request the General Manager, Parks, Forestry and Recreation to report to the Parks and Environment Committee in January 2015 to consider the requirement that businesses, industrial locations, institutions and multi-residential properties not be included in the exception categories under the By-law, thus requiring permits and replanting when dead and dying trees are removed.


Vote (Amend Item)

Jul-11-2014 9:58 AM
Result: Carried Majority Required - MM34.37 - De Baeremaeker - Motion 1
Yes: 26 Paul Ainslie, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), John Parker, James Pasternak, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

Motion to Adopt Item as Amended (Carried)

Vote (Adopt Item as Amended)

Jul-11-2014 9:59 AM
Result: Carried Majority Required - MM34.37 - Adopt the item as amended
Yes: 26 Paul Ainslie, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), John Parker, James Pasternak, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

Absent: 18 Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Gary Crawford, Vincent Crisanti, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, John Filion, Doug Ford, Mark Grimes, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Ron Moeser, Cesar Palacio, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, Karen Stintz 

MM54.38

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:18 
Liquor Licence - 33 Gladstone Avenue - The Coachouse - by Councillor Ana Bail�o, seconded by Councillor Sarah Doucette
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council direct the City Clerk to advise the Registrar of the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario that the liquor licence application for The Coachouse, 33 Gladstone Avenue (the “Premises”), is not in the public interest having regard to the needs and wishes of the residents, and that the Registrar should issue a Proposal to Review the liquor licence application.

 

2.         City Council request the Licence Appeal Tribunal to provide the City with an opportunity to be made a party in any proceedings with respect to the Premises.

 

3.         City Council authorize the City Solicitor to attend all proceedings before the Licence Appeal Tribunal in this matter and direct the City Solicitor to take all necessary actions so as to give effect to this Motion, including adding and deleting conditions to any liquor licence issued for the Premises, in consultation with the Ward Councillor, which address issues including, but not limited to, noise, safety, security personnel, security cameras, crowd control, signage, lighting and litter. 
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.38
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71360.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Ana Bail�o (Carried)

That Councillor Ana Bailão be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Liquor Licence - 33 Gladstone Avenue - The Coachouse

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as the Licence Appeal Tribunal may be scheduled and held prior to next City Council meeting.


Vote (Introduce Motion without Notice)

Jul-10-2014 9:57 AM
Result: Carried Two-Thirds full Council Required - Bailao - Add Urgent Motion

MM54.40

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:28 
Sony Centre for the Performing Arts, Heritage Easement Agreement Upgrades - by Councillor Pam McConnell, seconded by Councillor Gary Crawford
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council authorize the City to add the Heritage Easement Agreement upgrade to restore the sidewalk/pavers on the exterior of the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts by the end of September 2014, in an amount not to exceed $0.740 million net of HST recoveries, to the scope of work to be performed by Ferncastle (Front Street) Inc. on behalf of the City, inclusive of all related costs including obtaining a minimum of three quotes for all sub-contract work.

 

2.          City Council direct the City Solicitor and City officials to take whatever steps are necessary to implement Part 1 above, including the entering into of agreements on terms and conditions satisfactory to the City Manager, or his designate, and in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.40
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71363.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Gary Crawford (Carried)

That Councillor Pam McConnell be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Sony Centre for the Performing Arts, Heritage Easement Agreement Upgrades

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent because for health and safety reasons, and in order to ensure that the overall construction work is completed in advance of the Pan Am Games, the work to restore the sidewalk/pavers on the exterior of the Sony Centre must be completed by the end of September 2014.


Vote (Introduce Motion without Notice)

MM54.41

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:37 
Midland/Lawrence Toronto District School Board/Toronto Lands Corporation applications (Rezoning and Subdivison Applications No. 13 218652 ESC 37 OZ and 13 218659 ESC 37 SB and Site Plan Application 13 189360 ESC 37 SA) - by Councillor Michael Thompson, seconded by Councillor Glenn De Baeremaeker
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council direct the Chief Planner and Executive Director, City Planning Division to undertake further consultations with the local community with regards to the current Toronto District School Board/Toronto Lands Corporation planning applications on file, noted in this Motion, and report to the Scarborough Community Council in 2015 on the results of the community consultations  prior to proceeding with site plan approval for the new secondary school and prior to scheduling a Statutory Public Meeting for the proposed residential subdivision on the Bendale Business and Technical Institute school site.
Background Information (City Council)
Revised Member Motion MM54.41
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71381.pdf)
Motions (City Council)
Motion to Introduce Motion without Notice moved by Councillor Michael Thompson (Carried)

That Councillor Michael Thompson be permitted to add to the agenda of today's meeting an urgent Motion without notice concerning:

 

Midland/Lawrence Toronto District School Board/Toronto Lands Corporation applications (Rezoning and Subdivison Application Nos. 13 218652 ESC 37 OZ and 13 218659 ESC 37 SB and Site Plan Application 13 189360 ESC 37 SA)

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent because the Toronto Lands Corporation will be putting the David and Mary Thomson School site up for public sale which would deviate from the original plans presented to the community and would negatively impact the surrounding community. The Toronto Lands Corporation has proposed that an additional 370 to 400 stacked townhouses be built on this site without consulting the community and providing an opportunity to discuss the proposal. It is imperative that additional community consultation take place.


Vote (Introduce Motion without Notice)

Jul-11-2014 1:40 PM
Result: Carried Two-Thirds full Council Required - Thompson - Add Urgent Motion
Yes: 33 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, John Filion, Paula Fletcher, Doug Ford, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, Gord Perks, Anthony Perruzza, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

Absent: 12 Ana Bail�o, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, Mary Fragedakis, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Pam McConnell, Ron Moeser, James Pasternak, Karen Stintz 

Motion to Adopt Item (Carried)

Vote (Adopt Item)

Jul-11-2014 4:45 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - MM54.41 - Adopt the item
Yes: 30 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, John Filion, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

MM54.43

ACTION 

Adopted 

 

Ward:22 
Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to Toronto District School Board for the Deer Park Junior and Senior Public School Accessible Playground - by Councillor Josh Matlow, seconded by Councillor Kristyn Wong-Tam
City Council Decision

City Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014, adopted the following:

 

1.         City Council increase the 2014 Operating Budget for Non-Program by $300,000 gross, $0 net, fully funded by Section 37 community benefits related to 111 St. Clair Avenue West (source account: 220096) to provide one-time funding of $300,000.00 to the Toronto District School Board for Deer Park Junior and Senior Public School Accessible Playground Project.

 

2.         City Council direct that the $300,000 be forwarded to the Toronto District School Board once the Toronto District School Board signs an Undertaking governing the use of the funds and the reporting requirements and the maintenance of reasonable public access to the improved portion of the school grounds.
Background Information (City Council)
Member Motion MM54.43
(http://www.toronto.ca/legdocs/mmis/2014/mm/bgrd/backgroundfile-71384.pdf)

Authorization to Release Section 37 Funds to Toronto District School Board for the Deer Park Jr/Sr Public School Acessible Playground 

 

Reason for Urgency:

 

This motion is urgent as the fundraising must be completed in 2014.

July 10, 2014 at 8:00 p.m. - That leave be granted to introduce a Bill to confirm to the point of the introduction of this motion, the proceedings of Council Meeting 54 on July 8, 9 and 10, 2014.


Vote (Introduce and Pass Confirmatory Bill)

Jul-10-2014 8:00 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - Introduce the Confirming Bill
Yes: 29 Maria Augimeri, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, John Filion, Paula Fletcher, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, James Maloney, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 0  
Absent: 16 Paul Ainslie, Ana Bail�o, Gary Crawford, Vincent Crisanti, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, Doug Ford, Mary Fragedakis, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Giorgio Mammoliti, Ron Moeser, Cesar Palacio, John Parker, James Pasternak, Anthony Perruzza, Karen Stintz 

6 - Motion to Introduce and Pass Confirmatory Bill (Carried)

July 10, 2014 at 8:01 p.m. – That this Bill, prepared for this meeting of Council, be passed and hereby declared as a By-law, as follows:

 

Bill No.

By-law No.

Status

Title and Authority

723

648-2014

Enacted

To confirm the proceedings of City Council at Meeting 54 held on July 8, 9 and 10, 2014.

 


Vote (Introduce and Pass Confirmatory Bill)

Jul-10-2014 8:01 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - Enact the Confirming By-law
Yes: 28 Maria Augimeri, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, John Filion, Paula Fletcher, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, James Maloney, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, David Shiner, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 0  
Absent: 17 Paul Ainslie, Ana Bail�o, Gary Crawford, Vincent Crisanti, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, Doug Ford, Mary Fragedakis, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Giorgio Mammoliti, Ron Moeser, Cesar Palacio, John Parker, James Pasternak, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, Karen Stintz 

7 - Motion to Introduce and Pass General Bills moved by Councillor Gloria Lindsay Luby (Carried)

July 11, 2014 at 5:55 p.m. - That leave be granted to introduce Bills 640 to 661 and 663 to 720.


Vote (Introduce and Pass General Bills)

Jul-11-2014 5:55 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - Introduce General Bills
Yes: 25 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Shelley Carroll, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 0  
Absent: 20 Michelle Berardinetti, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, John Filion, Doug Ford, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Ron Moeser, James Pasternak, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Karen Stintz 

8 - Motion to Introduce and Pass General Bills (Carried)

July 11, 2014 at 5:56 p.m. – That these Bills, prepared for this meeting of Council, be passed and hereby declared as By-laws, as follows:

 

Bill No.

By-law No.

Status

Title and Authority

640

649-2014

Enacted

To permanently close untraveled portions of Danforth Avenue and Lillington Avenue.

Scarborough Community Council Item 33.2, as adopted by City of Toronto Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014.

641

650-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain land at the south-west corner of Eglinton Avenue West and Black Creek Drive for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Black Creek Drive.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

642

651-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain land on the north side of Danforth Avenue, east of Warden Avenue for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Danforth Avenue.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

643

652-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain land on the east side of Markham Road north of McNicoll Avenue for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Markham Road.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

644

653-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain lands south of Eastern Avenue for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Cherry Street.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

645

654-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain lands west of Cherry Street for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Front Street East.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

646

655-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain lands west of Cherry Street for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Mill Street.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

647

656-2014

Enacted

To dedicate certain lands on the north side of Clonmore Drive, west of Queensbury Avenue for public highway purposes to form part of the public highway Clonmore Drive.

Works Committee Report 1, Clause 4, adopted as amended, by City of Toronto Council on January 31, February 1 and 2, 2006.

648

657-2014

Enacted

To amend City of Toronto Municipal Code Chapter 880, Fire Routes, respecting Iceboat Terrace.

Toronto and East York Community Council Item 33.51, as adopted by City of Toronto Council on July 8, 9, 10 and 11, 2014.

Vote (Introduce and Pass General Bills)

Jul-11-2014 5:56 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - Enact Bills 640 to 661 and 663 to 720
Yes: 25 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Shelley Carroll, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam

Absent: 20 Michelle Berardinetti, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, John Filion, Doug Ford, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Ron Moeser, James Pasternak, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Karen Stintz 

9 - Motion to Introduce and Pass Bills (Two-thirds) moved by Councillor Gloria Lindsay Luby (Carried)

July 11, 2014 at 5:57 p.m. - That leave be granted to introduce Bill 662.


Vote (Introduce and Pass Bills (Two-thirds))

Jul-11-2014 5:57 PM
Result: Carried Two-Thirds Required - Introduce Bill 662
Yes: 25 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Shelley Carroll, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, Gord Perks, Ceta Ramkhalawansingh, Michael Thompson, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 0  
Absent: 20 Michelle Berardinetti, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, John Filion, Doug Ford, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, James Maloney, Giorgio Mammoliti, Pam McConnell, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Ron Moeser, James Pasternak, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Karen Stintz 

10 - Motion to Introduce and Pass Bills (Two-thirds) (Carried)

July 11, 2014 at 5:58 p.m. – That this Bill, prepared for this meeting of Council, be passed and hereby declared as a By-law, as follows:

 

Bill No.

Status

Title and Authority

Enacted

July 8, 2014 at 6:43 p.m. - That Council recess its public session to meet as Committee of the Whole in closed session to consider:

Report of Committee of the Whole

July 8, 2014 at 8:00 p.m. - Speaker Nunziata advised that City Council had completed its closed session consideration of the following item:

 

CC54.2 - Appointment of the Toronto Ombudsman

 

City Council adopted confidential instructions to staff during closed session.


Motion to Extend the Meeting moved by Councillor John Filion (Lost)

July 8, 2014 at 8:00 p.m. - That City Council extend the meeting past the 8:00 p.m. recess in order to complete Item CC54.2 and enact a confirming bill.

Jul-08-2014 8:00 PM

FRANCES NUNZIATA,                                ULLI S. WATKISS,
